result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. BIALEK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain full-time employment, schooling, work search or a combination.

Obtain GED or HSED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Continue current treatment.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for a Status Conference on 06-06-2016 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 3.  Bail is set at $150.00 cash with the conditions that he have no assaultive contact with Rhonda Bialek and maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail Issued.  Copy filed.
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.

Court authorizes warrant.

Ann Larson, public defender.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 01-15-16 at 10:30 a.m.   Plea date is set for 04-28-16 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Rhonda Bialek, on 11-26-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 12-21-15 at 1:30 p.m. Bail is set at $150.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, have no assaultive contact with Rhonda J. Bialek and maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
